question: B 01 (a)
sols_html:
Notice that \((x,y) = (4,3)\) is a point on the line. So the vector

\(v = \begin{bmatrix} 4 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}\)

is a matrix in the direction of L. To make it a unit vector, we divide the coordinates by the length of the vector. The length is given by

\(\| v \| = \sqrt{(4)^2 + (3)^3} = \sqrt{25} = 5\)

Thus, the unit vector is given by

\(\hat{a} = \begin{bmatrix} 4/5 \\ 3/5 \end{bmatrix}\)
